title: Iowa Senate passes controversial child labor bill
description: The Iowa Senate has passed a bill that would ease some child labor laws, including limits on hours minors can work and what job duties they are allowed to perform.

title: Boeing production problem spills over into summer travel
description: Boeing's production problems mean airlines will have fewer planes than they expected for summer travel. Delivery delays will remove nearly 9,000 seats from airline schedules.

title: Torch-carrying marchers indicted in Charlottesville rally nearly 6 years ago
description: A jury indicted multiple people on felony charges for carrying flaming torches with the intent to intimidate during a rally at the University of Virginia campus six years ago.

title: Ohio mom says viral parenting tip on TikTok helped her find her lost toddler in public: 'I knew what to do'
description: A woman from Ohio shared a viral TikTok video on how she successfully found her lost three-year-old daughter without yelling the small child's name in public.

title: Florida woman arrested in connection to road rage incident where she allegedly climbed atop car
description: The Florida Highway Patrol says a woman was arrested after she allegedly climbed on top of a car in an alleged road rage incident April 11.

title: California authorities bust Sikh gang suspects in years-long street war that started with sword attack
description: Authorities in California said 17 men have been arrested in connection with a 2018 Sikh temple shooting and a sword attack

title: MSNBC anchor Medhi Hasan accused of plagiarizing column on child spanking: 'Nearly word-for-word duplication'
description: Investigative reporter Lee Fang published a report accusing MSNBC host Mehdi Hasan of blatant plagiarism and unattributed references early on in his career.

title: GOP congressman endorses Trump for president despite 'positive' meeting with DeSantis
description: Rep. Lance Gooden, R-Texas, announced his endorsement for former President Donald Trump in the 2024 presidential race, despite what he said was a "positive" meeting with Ron DeSantis.

title: Jalen Hurts underwent surgery to remove 'hardware' from ankle prior to Eagles' extension: report
description: Philadelphia Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts reportedly underwent offseason surgery to remove 'hardware' from his ankle that stems from a 2018 surgery while at Alabama.

title: Georgia baseball with a twist: How the Savannah Bananas put a spin on the sport, delighting fans
description: The Savannah Bananas are a Georgia-based team that have gone viral on TikTok; they've gained followers for their unique, skit-based ballgame entertainment for the whole family.

title: 'Some' Boston Marathon runners not rewarded a medal as promised; athletic association vows they will be sent
description: The Boston Athletics Association confirmed that "some of" the Boston Marathon runners did not receive a congratulatory medal at the finish line.

title: Judge: Mississippi must allow religious exemption from school vaccine requirements
description: A Mississippi judge says the state must allow religious exemptions from vaccines required for children to attend school. It is unclear whether the department will appeal the ruling.

title: Michigan judge shortens prison term for man who killed mom, sisters as teen
description: A Kent County, Michigan, judge has shortened the sentence of Jon Siesling, who in 2003 killed his mother and two sisters, from life without parole to a maximum of 40 years.

title: Nebraska ethanol plant explosion kills worker, injures 4
description: An explosion at a Nebraska ethanol plant killed a worker and injured four others on Monday afternoon. The explosion happened during a routine repair on the tank.

title: Civil War reenactor pleads guilty to planting pipe bomb at VA battlefield, blaming Antifa
description: Civil War reenactor Gerald Drake, 63, of Winchester, Virginia, pleaded guilty Tuesday to charges alleging he planted a pipe bomb on a Harrisonburg battlefield.

title: 4 severely wounded in stabbing attack at German gym
description: Four people were gravely injured in a knife attack at a Duisburg, Germany gym. Police have not yet arrested a suspect, but noted that the perpetrator acted alone.

title: Fractured rail found in Minnesota derailment investigation
description: Federal investigators say BNSF railroad is examining a fractured section of rail in southwest Minnesota that may have contributed to a fiery train derailment last month.

title: Bidens report an adjusted gross income of $579,514
description: President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden reported a federal adjusted gross income of $579,514, according to their 2022 federal income tax returns released by the White House Tuesday.

title: University of Pittsburgh’s LGBTQ task force makes demands, including trans-inclusive healthcare and housing
description: The University of Pittsburgh’s LGTBQ task force posted several demands for the university to implement in conjunction with a call to organize a “walk-out" on Tuesday.

title: Rams deal veteran receiver Allen Robinson to Steelers: report
description: The Los Angeles Rams are reportedly finalizing a trade to send veteran wide receiver Allen Robinson to the Pittsburgh Steelers, who will pay about a third of his salary.

title: Julian Sands' son speaks out three months into search for missing actor
description: Julian Sands has been missing for more than three months after disappearing while on a dangerous hike in the San Bernardino mountain range near Los Angeles.

title: COVID booster dose for certain people approved by FDA
description: The FDA authorized a second dose of the upgraded COVID-19 booster manufactured by Pfizer and Moderna, for individuals over 65 and with weakened immune systems.

title: NBA Hall of Famer Charles Barkley takes jab at Clarence Thomas over trips with GOP megadonor
description: Charles Barkley made a joke at the expense Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas Sunday night in response to a report raising questions about gifts Thomas received from a GOP megadonor.

title: Boston Marathon spectators cite racism from police in cheer zone on race route
description: A predominantly Black racing club held a gathering at a cheer zone along the Boston Marathon route and was met with what they feel was an uneccesary police presence.

title: Indiana Senate advances firearms training fund for teachers and school employees
description: The Indiana Senate passed a bill 42-8 on Tuesday that would create a specialized firearms training course for teachers who want to carry guns in schools.

title: US charges diamond, art dealer allegedly tied to Hezbollah with evading sanctions
description: U.S. prosecutors on Tuesday announced charges against a financier accused of funnelling money to Hezbollah as part of an international movement against the network.

title: Priest speaks out after giving fiery homily addressing truth and transgender issues
description: The Fox News Lifestyle Newsletter brings you trending stories on family, travel, food, neighbors helping neighbors, pets, autos, military veterans, heroes, faith and American values.

title: DeSantis mingles with congressional Republicans as Trump expands his endorsement lead in 2024 race
description: A source in Gov. Ron DeSantis' political orbit says up to 30-40 Republican members of Congress may stop by a reception being headlined by the Florida governor in Washington D.C.

title: Michigan Supreme Court justice to miss case for mental health treatment
description: Michigan Supreme Court Justice Richard Bernstein will not hear a case next week, instead opting to travel out-of-state for mental health treatment.

title: Justice Department charges 4 Americans and 3 Russians for attempting to influence elections
description: The seven individuals face charges of acting as agents of Russia without informing the proper U.S. authorities prior to engaging in their activities.

title: Ohio police arrest teenager with loaded handgun outside amusement park
description: Ohio police arrested a teenager who allegedly was in possession of a handgun in a security area located just outside of the Kings Island amusement park.

title: Chip Roy pushes to ‘unwind’ Biden’s Inflation Reduction Act as part of debt ceiling deal
description: Rep. Chip Roy of Texas of the House Freedom Caucus wants to undo the Inflation Reduction Act as part of a deal that would raise the debt limit.

title: Top YouTuber MrBeast slams those criticizing his trans friend: ‘Transphobia starting to piss me off'
description: The world's most popular YouTuber, "MrBeast" lashed out at critics who have made the creator's trans friend a media spectacle in recent weeks.

title: Wisconsin Assembly passes bills outlawing local gas engine bans
description: The Wisconsin Assembly has passed a pair of bills outlawing state and local bans on gasoline-powered vehicle, lawnmower and snow blower engines.

title: Warriors’ Draymond Green ‘unlikely’ to be suspended after stepping on Kings’ Domantas Sabonis: report
description: Golden State Warriors forward Draymond Green is waiting to hear whether he’ll have to sit for a game after stepping on Sacramento Kings All-Star Domantas Sabonis during a playoff game Monday night

title: Alaska sky spiral caused by SpaceX excess fuel dump
description: Alaska's light baby blue sky spiral resembling a galaxy was caused by a SpaceX fuel dump. The SpaceX rocket had launched from California about three hours earlier.

title: Twitter Files journalist Taibbi says Musk spat 'clearly problematic' for free speech debate
description: Journalist Matt Taibbi, known for his work in publishing some of the Twitter Files, described his spat with Elon Musk, the new CEO of the social media platform.

title: Syria, Tunisia seek to restore diplomatic relations
description: Tunisian President Kais Saied met with Syria’s chief diplomat, saying the country wants to preserve the historical ties of brotherhood with Damascus and boost bilateral cooperation.

title: Gold Roman coin found near Pompeii fetches eye-opening amount at auction
description: A coin first discovered in 1895 in the ashes of Pompeii sold at auction recently for nearly $22,400 — it's a gold coin that celebrates that conquest of Britain by Emperor Claudius.

title: Police in Argentina's capital to start using stun guns
description: Police in Argentina's capital of Buenos Aires will start using stun guns amidst concern over crime in an election year. Officers will start using them in June or July once trained.

title: Michigan State hires security firm to review mass shooting response
description: Michigan State University has hired Security Risk Management Consultants, an Ohio-based firm, to review the school's response to a February mass shooting that left three students dead.

title: Alabama police establish tip line for photos, videos from Sweet 16 shooting
description: The Alabama Law Enforcement Agency is collaborating with the FBI to establish a digital tip line for photo and video evidence of a mass shooting at a Dadeville teen's birthday party.

title: Republicans block Schumer’s request to replace Feinstein on Judiciary Committee
description: Senate Majority Leader Schumer told reporters earlier on Tuesday that he spoke with Feinstein last week and they both were 'hopeful' she'd be back soon

title: Iowa man pleads guilty to using Apple AirTags to stalk woman he said was his wife
description: An Iowa man pleaded guilty to charges related to an incident where he is accused of stalking a woman he thought was his wife with several Apple AirTags.

title: Bills’ Josh Allen looking to adjust playing style ahead 2023 NFL season: ‘Availability is the best ability’
description: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen said Tuesday he plans to switch from "a football player first and a quarterback second" mindset soon following last year's performance.

title: FOX News Media, Dominion Voting Systems reach agreement over defamation lawsuit
description: FOX News Media and Dominion Voting System reached a multi-million-dollar agreement following a legal battle that was expected to go to trial this week.

title: Mob randomly attacks couple walking in Chicago: They said they were 'going to kill us'
description: DJ and Ashley detail the random and brutal attack against them while walking in downtown Chicago after video of their attack went viral online on "America Reports."

title: Bill Barr joins group targeting progressive prosecutors: 'Enforce our law'
description: Former AG Bill Barr has joined the advisory board of Protecting Americans Action Fund led by Virginia AG Jason Miyares aimed at stopping "progressive prosecutors."

title: Aaron Carter's official cause of death revealed: coroner
description: Aaron Carter's official cause of death was revealed by the LA County Department of Medical Examiner-Coroner Tuesday, six months after he died at home in Lancaster.

title: Boston Marathon runner appears to take bathroom break on someone's front lawn
description: A participant of the Boston Marathon picked a bad time to have the runs — pun intended. So, he went on someone's front lawn, which became his own bathroom.

title: WH says Feinstein’s replacement 'reasonable,' slams GOP for targeting health despite bipartisan agreement
description: The White House has said Sen. Dianne Feinstein's, D-Calif., request to have a temporary replacement fill her role on the Senate Judiciary Committee is "reasonable."

title: Mississippi sheriff declares arrest warrant for Emmett Till accuser moot
description: Leflore County, Mississippi Sheriff Ricky Banks has declined to serve a 1955 arrest warrant for Carolyn Donham, who was reportedly involved in Emmett Till's kidnapping and murder.

title: Nebraska Legislature finally passes a bill, amidst progressive filibusters
description: Despite two-thirds of Nebraska's legislative session being over, the state Senate has only passed one bill as leftist members force it to a halt over a proposed youth sex change ban.

title: Gisele Bündchen shows Tom Brady what he's missing after split in sexy photo shoot
description: Gisele Bündchen posed for a new jewelry campaign six months after her divorce from Tom Brady. The supermodel has also shared reflective thoughts on social media since the breakup.

title: Bills' Damar Hamlin discusses cause of cardiac arrest during Bengals game: 'I died on national TV'
description: Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin detailed what happened the night he suffered cardiac arrest on the field during a game against the Cincinnati Bengals Jan. 2.

title: New York City parking garage collapses, leaving multiple people injured, 1 dead
description: A multi-level parking structure in Manhattan partially collapsed Tuesday around 4:15 p.m., injuring multiple people with at least one confirmed death.

title: Elon Musk knocks 'absurdly overstaffed' Twitter, 'desperate' media in Tucker Carlson sit-down
description: Twitter CEO Elon Musk details his decision to cut jobs at the social media company and criticizes legacy media for increasing the 'negativity of the news.'

title: Antonio Brown ushered off arena football field by security despite ownership: 'This my field, I’m the owner'
description: Former NFL player and current National Arena League team owner Antonio Brown was kicked off the field by a security guard during the team's season opener on Sunday.

title: New York man accused of killing woman in driveway had 'short fuse,' hated trespassers: report
description: A New York man accused of fatally shooting a 20-year-old woman traveling in a car that made a wrong turn up his driveway reportedly hated trespassers.

title: California doctor who says wife spiked tea with Drano suffers from acid reflux, not poisoning: lawyer
description: California attorney says doctor has been falsely accused of spiking her husband's tea with Drano, and her spouse sustained his injuries from acid reflux disease.

title: Bloody Sudan conflict continues despite truce, international pressure
description: Gunfire continued in Sudan's streets Tuesday amid a major power struggle between two generals, despite an internationally-brokered truce taking effect just hours earlier.

title: German police report 7 soldiers injured in armored vehicle crash on Bavarian highway
description: German police reported Tuesday that seven military personnel of an undisclosed nationality were injured after an armored vehicle collision on a Bavarian highway.

title: T. rex skeleton sells for over $5M at Swiss auction
description: A 38-foot-long composite Tyrannosaurus rex skeleton comprised of bones from three different dig sites sold for 4.8 million Swiss francs ($5.3 million) at a Zurich auction Tuesday.

title: OpenAI CEO says era of giant AI models is over
description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said the era of the giant artificial intelligence model, like his ChatGPT, has come to an end, and that his AI company is not developing GTP-5.

title: Charles Stanley, Atlanta pastor, televangelist and In Touch Ministries founder, dead at 90
description: Atlanta, Georgia-based In Touch Ministries founder Dr. Charles Stanley died peacefully in his home Tuesday, after years of preaching about God.

title: Schumer says defunding law enforcement is 'dangerous,' despite refusing to reject calls for defunding police
description: Sen. Chuck Schumer claimed that calls to defund the police are "dangerous" despite refusing resolutions to oppose the movement in 2020.

title: Delicious fruits and veggies that are ripe in the springtime and the best ways to use them in your recipes
description: During springtime, many fruits and vegetables including apricots, avocados, pineapples, spinach, lemons and strawberries are all back in season.

title: Austin home invasion suspect fatally shot by resident, no charges to be filed: police
description: Charges will not be filed against an Austin homeowner who shot and killed a suspect after he broke into their residence around 5:30 a.m. on Tuesday morning, police said.

title: Bodycam footage shows Ohio State's Brian Hartline being helped after ATV crash
description: Police bodycam footage showed the moment where they arrived on scene at Ohio State offensive coordinator Brian Hartline's home after he crashed his ATV.

title: Reba McEntire reveals why she performed in ‘beer joints and honky tonks’ at 13 years old
description: Garth Brooks interviewed Reba McEntire on TalkShopLive this week, where she revealed she's been performing in clubs since she was a young teenager.

title: Swedish golfer Linn Grant to miss first LPGA major due to vaccination status
description: Linn Grant, the 22nd-ranked player in the world, will miss the first LPGA major championship because she is unvaccinated against COVID-19.

title: NASA's James Webb Space Telescope captures spectacular image of ultra-bright merging galaxies
description: NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope has captured a stunning image of Arp 220, a merger of galaxies more than 700 million years old and with a luminosity of more than a trillion suns.

title: Hawley grills Mayorkas on reports of forced child migrant labor: 'Why shouldn't you be impeached for this?'
description: Sen. Josh Hawley grilled DHS Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas over a bombshell report about an increase in forced child labor among unaccompanied children who came to the US.

title: Warriors' broadcast cuts Draymond Green slack for stomp: 'Don't think he had a choice'
description: The Golden State Warriors broadcast cut Draymond Green slack for stomping on Domantas Sabonis during the fourth quarter of Golden State's Game 2 loss.

title: No charges in police killing of pallbearer during his father's funeral
description: A Grant County prosecutor decided charges will not be brought against members of the police force who shot a pallbearer at his dad's funeral. The victim was reaching for a weapon.

title: Texas man accused of threatening to kill Rep. Maxine Waters in racist voicemails
description: A man in Houston, Texas, has been arrested and charged with leaving multiple threatening messages on the voicemail of Democratic Rep. Maxine Waters of California.

title: Jazz star Lauri Markkanen reports to Finland for mandatory military service: 'It’s a new challenge'
description: Following his best season in the NBA yet, Utah Jazz All-Star forward Lauri Markkanen reported to Finland on Monday to complete his mandatory military service.

title: Press freedom groups: Spyware again used against Mexican human rights activists
description: Press freedom groups said Tuesday that the Mexican government has continued to use Pegasus spyware to infect the telephones of human rights activists

title: Pizza delivery man praised by police after tripping fleeing suspect: 'I was in the middle of the movie'
description: Tyler Morrell joined "Fox & Friends" to discuss tripping a suspect running from Pennsylvania police during a regular afternoon delivering pizzas.

title: States seeking to restrict animal tranquilizer linked to overdoses
description: U.S. states are seeking to restrict access to an animal tranquilizer that has been linked to overdoses. Gov. Josh Shapiro will add xylazine to the list of controlled substances.

title: GOP mayor considering 2024 presidential run says defeating Trump, DeSantis is possible by 'inspiring people'
description: Mayor Francis Suarez of Miami, Florida, during a stop in New Hampshire, tells Fox News he's "seriously considering" a run for the 2024 Republican presidential nomination.

title: Marquette University student found dead in dorm room
description: A student at Marquette University in Milwaukee was found dead in his dorm room on Monday, the university's police department said in a statement.

title: High School Musical star promotes witchcraft for new film: 'Something that I am very passionate about’
description: Former Disney Channel star Vanessa Hudgens is promoting witchcraft to fans through a new documentary about her spiritual journey in the occult.

title: Ray Romano could have suffered ‘widowmaker’ heart attack before undergoing heart procedure
description: Actor Ray Romano revealed that he had to have a stent placed in an artery after his doctor found that 90% of his main artery was blocked.

title: Conservative org prepares aggressive plan for DHS overhaul if Republicans win White House in 2024
description: A project by the Heritage Foundation is outlining how a Republican administration could reshape the Department of Homeland Security in ways that are radical and durable.

title: Schools, museums turn to AI to detect guns but tech suffers notable fails
description: Artificial intelligence systems that detect weapons are increasingly being implemented at schools and other public areas to protect against potential tragedies.

title: China offers to facilitate Israeli-Palestinian peace talks
description: China told Israeli and Palestinian counterparts that the country wants to facilitate peace talks. Foreign Minister Qin Gang expressed concern over intensifying tensions.

title: Late-season storm brings more snow to the Sierra Nevada
description: A late-season storm is bringing more snow in the Sierra Nevada region of California and Nevada Tuesday. The early morning temperature was 18 degrees.

title: 'I feel manipulated,' daughter says at mother's murder trial
description: The daughter of a woman accused of killing her stepson said she had no idea his body was in the car as they drove across the country. The mother dumped his body off a bridge in Florida.

title: Office of Special Counsel finds HHS Secretary Xavier Becerra violated federal law
description: The Office of Special Counsel found that HHS Secretary Xavier Becerra violated the Hatch Act by advocating for Democrat California Senator Alex Padilla's re-election in 2022.

title: Andrew Lester, Kansas City man accused of shooting teen Ralph Yarl, surrenders to police
description: A Missouri man has surrendered to police after allegedly shooting a teenager who mistakingly rang his doorbell.

title: Bruins' Tyler Bertuzzi goes viral in Stanley Cup playoffs debut for trolling Panthers' Nick Cousins
description: Monday night may have marked Boston Bruins winger Tyler Bertuzzi's playoff debut, but the former Detroit Red Wing looked like a natural.

title: Judge rules UMich grad student strike unfair
description: An administrative law judge ruled that striking graduate students at the University of Michigan breached their duty to bargain in good faith by violating a contractual no-strike clause.

title: Georgia homeowner shoots and kills man breaking into his home, police say
description: A Georgia homeowner shot and killed a would-be intruder breaking into a home Sunday night, police said.

title: Senate could vote today on replacing Feinstein in committee, Schumer says
description: Democrats want to replace Sen Feinstein on the Senate Judiciary Committee, but Republicans are likely to derail the vote if it moves forward this afternoon as Schumer hopes.

title: Armed suspect posing as deliveryman in alleged Connecticut home invasion attempt caught on camera
description: A man allegedly pretended to deliver a package to a Connecticut home but had a gun and planned to zip tie the owners and rob the home, according to police

title: ‘Deadliest Catch’ stars reflect on facing 'violent' Bering Sea in new season: ‘It’s a younger person’s game’
description: "Deadliest Catch," a popular reality TV series, has been airing since 2005. The show follows fishermen in the Bering Sea during the Alaskan king and snow crab season.

title: Chicago's DePaul University rocked after convicted sex offender allegedly attacks two women
description: A registered Wisconsin sex offender is accused of attacking three women last week at DePaul University in Chicago's upscale Lincoln Park neighborhood.

title: Mexican president accused of wiretapping activists, violating pledge
description: Press freedom groups are accusing Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador of illegally allowing his military to spy on human rights activists.

title: AEW star Britt Baker talks balance of being wrestler and dentist, why she's a big believer in Tony Khan
description: Britt Baker talked to Fox News Digital about how she got into pro wrestling, her life as a wrestler and dentist, and why she thinks highly of Tony Khan and how he's run AEW.

title: Supreme Court signals it will make it easier for workers to claim religious accommodations
description: The U.S. Supreme Court heard oral arguments in Groff v. DeJoy Tuesday, which concerns a Christian mail worker who claims the U.S. Postal Service wrongfully fired him after failing to accommodate his beliefs about the Sabbath.

title: Jamie Foxx's body double films with Cameron Diaz as star recovers from mystery illness
description: Jamie Foxx's body double was spotted filming "Back in Action" with Cameron Diaz as Foxx recovers from an undisclosed "medical complication."

title: Largest-ever Wisconsin land conservation project dies in Legislature
description: A $15 million, 56,000-acre land purchase in Wisconsin's Pelican River Forest has been rejected by the state Legislature's budget committee.

title: Florida road rage incident leaves two girls shot after dads' stand-your-ground gunfight
description: Two girls, ages 5 and 14, were shot on a Florida highway after their dads allegedly exchanged gunfire in a road rage clash, according to court records.

title: It's time to take control of your online privacy with Amazon
description: Amazon, like many online sites we share our information with, can share your information with third-party sites, but you are in control of what is shared.

title: Lori Vallow trial: 'Cult mom' gets emotional during sole surviving son's testimony
description: Colby Ryan, Lori Vallow's surviving son, testified Tuesday in the 'cult' mom's murder trial. Vallow appeared to cry as Ryan took the witness stand, according to local reports.

title: Oklahoma trooper pulls over driver allegedly going 135 mph: 'Late for work'
description: Oklahoma officials say a state trooper pulled over a woman who was traveling 65 mph over the speed limit Monday in Oklahoma City.

title: King Charles makes surprising gesture toward Meghan Markle in official coronation program
description: Although Meghan Markle will not be attending King Charles' coronation weekend in May, she is still being included in a photograph for the official coronation program.

title: Slim by summer: Health experts share top tips to lose 10 pounds by beach season
description: Read 9 healthy ways to lose 10 pounds by summer, according to nutritionists who offer smart choices to help you accomplish your weight loss goals.

title: Missouri House votes to limit transgender student athletes
description: The Missouri House voted Monday to set limits on transgender student athletes in grade 6 through college from playing on the same team as other girls and women.

title: Gun safety protesters carry caskets to Tennessee Capitol
description: Gun safety demonstrators were blocked from bringing caskets inside Tennessee’s Capitol as they protested. A legislator carried an infant-sized casket inside before he was stopped.

title: Funeral set for remaining victim of Louisville bank shooting
description: A funeral has been set for the remaining victim of the Louisville bank mass shooting. Five people were killed when a bank employee fired a AR-15 semi-automatic rifle inside the bank.

title: Trump calls DeSantis' war with Disney 'unnecessary,' says he needs to 'work on squatter MESS'
description: Donald Trump fired at Ron DeSantis Tuesday over the governors battle with Disney and squatters in the sunshine state illegally taking over small business landlords.

title: Bipartisan legislation in House and Senate aims to ban 'deeply corrupt' stock trades by members of Congress
description: Lawmakers in the House and Senate introduced new legislation that would ban members of Congress and their families from trading stocks while in office.

title: Miguel Cardona repeatedly refuses to define 'woman' in tense hearing exchange with GOP's Clyde
description: Secretary of Education Miguel Cardona repeatedly refused to define "woman" or definitively explain the extent of "equal access" for transgender students during a committee hearing Tuesday.

title: Nancy Pelosi campaign coughs up $7,500 after man sues over 'invasive' fundraising texts
description: Nancy Pelosi's campaign gave an Illinois man $7,500 to settle a lawsuit alleging that her campaign had violated federal laws against robocalls and text messages.

title: Abortion providers pushing handheld abortion tech to primary care clinics across U.S.: ‘A gamechanger'
description: A network of abortion providers is looking to spread a "quick and discreet" abortion procedure to clinics throughout the U.S.

title: New York AG Letitia James to host 'first-ever statewide community gun buyback' in late April
description: New York Attorney General Letitia James' office announced Tuesday she will host the first-ever statewide community gun buyback across nine locations April 29.

title: Washington bill seeking to set minimum marriage age of 18 stalls
description: A Washington state bill stalled again in the Legislature seeking to set the minimum marriage age to 18 years old. The state is one of many that don’t specify a minimum age for marriage.

title: Flesh-eating bacteria infections may rise as climate warms, study finds
description: Infections of the flesh-eating bacteria Vibrio vulnificus are rising along the eastern U.S. as the world's overall climate changes, according to scientists.

title: Taraji P. Henson partners with HBCUs on mental wellness
description: Taraji P. Henson has partnered with HBCUs on mental wellness. The foundations are aiming to increase availability of resources in the Black community for mental health issues.

title: UN: Thousands in West Africa face acute food shortage
description: Central and West Africa are at the brink of famine as the regions face a 10-year-high food insecurity caused by the coronavirus pandemic, climate change, and high prices.

title: Devastating hospital fire in Beijing kills 21 people
description: Dozens of people were killed in a rare hospital fire that broke out at China’s Changfeng Hospital. The cause of the blaze is still under investigation.

title: Ernst accuses IRS of 'witch hunt' against small businesses with audit proposal
description: Sen. Joni Ernst, the top Republican on the Senate Small Business Committee, sent a letter to the IRS demanding more information on its plan to increase audits on large businesses

title: Georgia jail transfers 600 inmates after man allegedly eaten alive by insects
description: The Fulton County Jail is transferring 600 inmates after deceased Lashawn Thompson was allegedly eaten alive by bugs while in his cell in the jail's psychiatric wing.

title: Argentina sterilizes mosquitoes with radiation to battle devastating dengue outbreak
description: Biologists in Argentina are battling one of the country’s worst dengue outbreaks by sterilizing male mosquitos with atomic radiation. They plan to release the insects outdoors in November.

title: Iowa teens plead guilty in Spanish teacher’s fatal beating
description: Iowa teens Willard Miller and Jeremy Goodale pleaded guilty Tuesday in connection to the fatal beating of high school Spanish teacher Nohema Graber.

title: Palestinian gunman shoots 2 Israelis in Jerusalem, the latest bloodshed in a cycle of violence
description: Two Israelis were shot in Jerusalem by a Palestinian gunman on April 18, 2023. The men were wounded in the shooting. Police are still searching for the suspected gunman.

title: Former President Bill Clinton says he is optimistic Northern Ireland government will be revived soon
description: Bill Clinton met with the Democratic Unionist Party leader on Monday. After the meeting he claimed he was optimistic a main Northern Ireland political party would end its boycott soon.

title: Maine State Police say 4 dead, 3 injured in shootings in Bowdoin, Yarmouth
description: Maine State Police say a series of shooting incidents in Bowdoin and Yarmouth that are connected have left four dead and three injured, while a person of interest is in custody.

title: Shooting along I-295 in Yarmouth, Maine leaves 2 injured as police searching for person of interest: report
description: Maine State Police have taken one person into custody so far following a shooting along Interstate-295 in Yarmouth, outside of Portland.

title: House Armed Services and Intelligence Committees launch investigation into classified document leaks
description: House Intelligence Committee Chairman Mike Turner and House Armed Services Committee Chairman Mike Rogers are investigating the leak of classified national security and defense secrets and documents online.

title: Reinstated Tennessee lawmaker blocked from carrying infant-sized casket onto House floor in latest gun protest
description: Democratic state Reps. Justin Jones and Justin Pearson were photographed at a gun control rally on Monday, helping carry caskets into the Tennessee legislature.

description: Pras Michel, who became a best-selling hip-hop artist with the 1990s group Fugees, is launching his defense in a multimillion-dollar political conspiracy trial.

title: Patti LuPone bashes Christian Right as no different from the Taliban in rant on 'The View': 'I could cry'
description: Actress Patti LuPone told the hosts of "The View" on Tuesday that she doesn't know the difference between "our Christian Right and the Taliban."

title: EU seeks AI regulation, calls for summit on emerging tech as European workers fear oncoming job loss
description: European Commission members of parliament have said they voice similar concerns to the open letter from tech experts and leaders but did not agree with the "alarmist statements."

title: 'American Idol' audience boos Katy Perry for another questionable critique
description: Katy Perry was booed by the "American Idol" audience after she gave what many perceived to be an unfair critique to fan favorite Nutsa.

title: Ralph Yarl's classmates hold ‘Unity Walk’ in show of support following Kansas City shooting
description: Students at Staley High School in Kansas City marched in support of Ralph Yarl, a Black teen who is recovering after allegedly being shot by a White man.

title: Nets' Ben Simmons praises Chinese official who praised CCP, denied Uyghur genocide
description: Brooklyn Nets star Ben Simmons praised a Chinese official who dismissed reporters of persecution against Uyghur Muslims.

title: Toddler invades White House grounds by slipping through fence: 'Curious young visitor'
description: A toddler briefly entered the White House grounds through the fence on Tuesday. After security systems were triggered, Secret Service members reunited the child with its parents.

title: Alex Berenson sues Biden, Pfizer honchos over Twitter ban that came as he raised concerns about COVID vaccine
description: Alex Berenson is suing President Biden, White House officials and Pfizer honchos, accusing them of violating his rights by pushing for his removal from Twitter.

title: Wisconsin state archaeologist dies after being found unresponsive during diving training
description: James Skibo, a 63-year-old Wisconsin archaeologist, has died after being found unresponsive during a training dive in Madison Lake. He was diving with two other people.

title: Biden’s Navy secretary blasted for ignoring Congress on fleet strength: ‘You are violating the law’
description: Sen. Dan Sullivan, R-Alaska, blasted Navy Secretary Carlos Del Toro for ignoring the will of Congress and putting forward a budget without enough amphibious ships.

title: 2 Iowa teens plead guilty to murder after beating high school teacher to death
description: Willard Miller and Jeremy Goodale have pleaded guilty to first degree murder after fatally beating their high school Spanish teacher. The teacher's body was found in a park.

title: Health provider drops West Virginia lawsuit seeking to overturn state abortion ban
description: The Women's Health Center of West Virginia has dropped its lawsuit seeking to revoke the state’s near-total abortion ban “due to intervening professional obligations."

title: Ex-Notre Dame head coach to join Atlanta Hawks staff: reports

title: Alabama 16-year-old birthday girl begged dying older brother to ‘stay with me’ following mass shooting

title: NY Board of Regents unanimously approves policy barring indigenous mascots statewide
